Content:: The COVID-19 pandemic in Algeria is part of the worldwide pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The virus was confirmed to have spread to Algeria in February 2020.[3] In December it was announced that Algeria intended to launch COVID-19 vaccinations in January 2021.[4] On 12 January, the World Health Organization (WHO) confirmed that a novel coronavirus was the cause of a respiratory illness in a cluster of people in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China, who had initially come to the attention of the WHO on 31 December 2019.[5][6] Unlike SARS of 2003, the case fatality ratio for COVID-19[7][8] has been much lower, but the transmission has been significantly greater, with a significant total death toll.[9][7]
Title: COVID-19 pandemic in Algeria - Wikipedia
